title: Why is ashe 33% of the adcs I seen in silver and below
body:
Seriously, like. Whats the draw? 

Am I in the elo that doesn't watch youtube or care about meta picks?

Not down putting the pick I'm seriously curious.

replies.body: She's a really strong pick considering that her kiting skills are amazing with that passive and it takes almost no ability to kite with her as long as you can avoid the skillshots. I play Ashe just because she's a solid pick that I have an easy time with therefore a stable pick in ranked for scrubs like me. Although other ADC's are meta right now, players should play who they feel comfortable rather than a completely awkward skill set. It also so just happens that Ashe is a fairly beginner adc.

Ashe is a utility carry.  If you fall behind early, you still carry a ton of utility in her kit to still be useful to your team.  Most other carries require damage to be useful, but with Ashe if you can land an ultimate, it's almost a guaranteed kill if someone follows it up.  

Having engage is so important.  As an ADC you normally have to wait for your support or top laner to do something or pray your mid lands a stun and the others follow up.  Meanwhile, you're standing there waiting for this to happen, which may never happen.  At least by having CC in your control, you can initiate a fight when you see fit instead of waiting for someone else to grow some balls and go in, which is what most other ADCs have to do.
Ashe is a good pick in general with plenty of utility in her kit, her major downside is that she is immobile like a few other adc's  and is a little more vulnerable.
she's cheap and her ult can start or end teamfights, something that low elo players find it hard to decide which is needed.

She has a lot of utility so she's one of the few ADCs that can still be relevant even when behind. It's a good choice if you're not confident that you're gonna win lane.
I see Ashe, every time I pick Jhin. Such a fun lane.

I think part of it might be safety?  By which I don't necessarily mean laning safety but rather relevance safety.  If I'm playing Ashe and I fall behind the other ADC, I know I can still meaningfully contribute vision and CC even if my damage is lacking.  Obviously it would be BETTER if I also had damage, but having a good side of utility ensures I can contribute to a team fight from behind.

Or for a non game play angle, she's very cheap to unlock as a permanent addition to your roster, which can be an important selling point for people who are trying not to spend real money on the game.  Even if now they have more IP than they know what to do with, Ashe may still be a comfort pick from when it was an issue.

No, that means that Ashe is meta for your bracket of play.  As a side note, she is also strong enough to get a nerf recently.

And a reason she is is popular among new players, is well... simply because playing with her comes at the price tag of 450IP.
